Headline: 30 years after Mount Pinatubo eruption, scientists look at how S'pore can be better prepared, Environment News & Top Stories - The Straits Times
Text: Read 3 articles daily and stand to win ST rewards, including the ST News Tablet worth $398.Spin the wheel for ST Read and Win now.SINGAPORE - Three decades after Mount Pinatubo in the Philippines billowed enough ash to blanket Singapore and cut out enough sunlight worldwide to cool the Earth for years, Nanyang Technological University (NTU) scientists are looking into how the Republic can better prepare for future eruptions.The eruption on June 15, 1991 - the world's largest in the past 100 years - sent ash to Singapore on the evening of June 17.
